meanings.definition: To remove the skin from (an animal or fruit)
meanings.sent1: She was skinning the apple with a peeler.
meanings.sent2: The hunter was skinning the deer after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was skilled at skinning fruits for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The sun was skinning the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush moved swiftly, skinning the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the skin from something
meanings.sent1: The skinning of the potato was done carefully to avoid waste.
meanings.sent2: The skinning of the animal was necessary for the leather industry.
meanings.sent3: The skinning of the banana peel made the monkey slip comically.
meanings.sent4: The skinning of the onion revealed its many layers of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The skinning of the tree bark exposed the intricate patterns underneath.
